American Bollworm on Cotton.description: Larvae feed on leaves, squares, and bolls, causing flaring of squares and premature boll shedding.
symptoms: Older larvae bore into bolls and squares
Flared squares and premature boll shedding
Presence of larvae with varying colors on plants
management_steps: Spray Indoxacarb 14.5 SC or Spinosad 45 SC
Use HaNPV (virus) sprays in early stages
prevention: Deep summer ploughing to destroy pupae
Intercrop with green gram, black gram, or cowpea
Plant trap crops like marigold or castor

Anthracnose on Cotton.description: Fungal disease causing reddish-brown spots on leaves and bolls, often leading to boll rot.
symptoms: Small reddish to light brown spots on leaves
Stem splitting or shredding in severe cases
management_steps: Seed treatment with Captan or Thiram
Foliar spray of Mancozeb or Copper Oxychloride
Apply Carbendazim at boll formation stage
prevention: Remove and burn infected plant debris

Army worm.description: Caterpillars feed gregariously on foliage, skeletonizing leaves giving a 'grazed' appearance.
symptoms: Larvae often found hiding in whorls during day
management_steps: Apply poison baits (bran + jaggery + insecticide) in evening
prevention: Monitor for egg masses and young larvae
Dig trenches around field to stop migration

Becterial Blight in Rice.description: Bacterial infection causing wilting of seedlings (Kresek) and yellowing/drying of leaves.
symptoms: Water-soaked lesions with wavy yellow margins
Milky bacterial ooze drops on young lesions in morning
management_steps: Drain field water and irrigate with fresh water
prevention: Avoid clipping seedling tips during transplanting
Destroy weed hosts and infected stubble

Brownspot.description: Fungal disease often associated with poor soil nutrition, causing brown oval spots.
symptoms: Oval or circular dark brown spots with halo
Spots on glumes leading to black kernels
Leaves dry out and wither in severe cases
prevention: Seed treatment with Captan or Thiram

Common_Rust.description: Fungal disease causing powdery pustules on leaves, reducing photosynthetic area.
symptoms: Small, powdery, cinnamon-brown pustules on leaves
Pustules turn black as plant matures
Pustules appear on both upper and lower leaf surfaces
management_steps: Spray Mancozeb or Zineb immediately on symptom appearance
Repeat spray after 15 days if needed
prevention: Plant early to avoid peak disease pressure

Cotton Aphid.description: Sucking pests that colonize undersides of leaves, excreting honeydew and causing sooty mold.
symptoms: Yellowing and downward curling of leaves
Black sooty mold growing on honeydew
management_steps: Wash plants with strong water jet (small scale)
prevention: Remove weeds acting as alternate hosts

Flag Smut.description: Systemic fungal infection causing grey-black streaks on leaves and stems.
symptoms: Long, raised, grey-black streaks on leaves/sheaths
Leaves twist, curl, and wither (flag leaf twisted)
Sooty black spore mass released when streaks rupture
Stunted plants failing to produce heads
management_steps: Seed treatment is the ONLY effective cure (Carboxin)
Foliar sprays are generally ineffective once infected
Rogue out and burn infected clumps
prevention: Compulsory seed treatment with Vitavax or Bavistin

Gray_Leaf_Spot.description: Fungal disease causing rectangular grey lesions, limiting yield in humid conditions.
symptoms: Small, necrotic spots with yellow halos
Elongated, rectangular grey/tan lesions parallel to veins
Stalk lodging due to reduced leaf area
prevention: Rotate with soybeans or other non-hosts

Healthy Maize.description: Plant appears healthy with no visible signs of disease or pest damage.
management_steps: Scout field weekly for early pest signs

Healthy Wheat.description: Plant appears healthy with no visible signs of disease or pest damage.
management_steps: Monitor for rusts and aphids regularly

Healthy cotton.description: Plant appears healthy with no visible signs of disease or pest damage.
management_steps: Regular scouting for bollworms and sucking pests
Nutrient management based on soil test

Leaf Curl.description: Viral disease transmitted by whiteflies causing severe curling and stunting.
symptoms: Upward or downward curling of leaves
Thickening and darkening of veins (vein clearing)
Stunted growth and reduced boll formation
management_steps: Apply Neem oil to repel vectors
prevention: Avoid growing cotton near okra or tomato

Leaf smut.description: Fungal disease causing small black spots on leaves.
symptoms: Small, leaden-black, slightly raised spots on leaves
Spots may be angular or rectangular
Leaves turn yellow and dry in severe cases
Often occurs late in the season
management_steps: Usually minor, no heavy chemical needed
If severe, spray Propiconazole or Copper Oxychloride

Mosaic sugarcane.description: Viral disease causing mottled patterns on leaves, transmitted by aphids.
symptoms: Mottled pattern of light and dark green on leaves
Reddening of older leaves in severe cases
management_steps: Control aphid vectors with Imidacloprid or Dimethoate
prevention: Control weeds in and around the field

RedRot sugarcane.description: The 'Cancer of Sugarcane', causing internal reddening and alcohol smell.
symptoms: Yellowing and drying of 3rd or 4th leaf from top
Internal stalk tissue turns red with white transverse bands
Sour alcoholic smell from split canes
Hollow cavities with ash-colored fungal growth
management_steps: Immediately dig out and burn infected clumps
Drench soil with Carbendazim around spot
prevention: Use healthy setts from proper nurseries
Treat setts with Carbendazim before planting

RedRust sugarcane.description: Fungal disease usually on leaves, causing orange-brown pustules.
symptoms: Small, elongated yellow spots on leaves
Spots turn orange-brown to red-brown pustules
Pustules mainly on lower leaf surface
Severe infection leads to leaf drying
prevention: Avoid high Nitrogen and low Potassium

Rice Blast.description: Devastating fungal disease affecting leaves, nodes, and panicle necks.
symptoms: Eye-shaped (spindle) spots with grey centers on leaves
Rotting of neck (Neck Blast) causing whiteheads
prevention: Treat seeds with Tricyclazole or Thiram

Sugarcane Healthy.description: Plant appears healthy with no visible signs of disease or pest damage.

Tungro.description: Viral disease transmitted by Green Leafhopper, causing yellowing and stunting.
symptoms: Plants are stunted with reduced tillering
Leaves turn yellow to orange-yellow from tip
management_steps: Use light traps to catch leafhoppers

Wheat Brown leaf Rust.description: Fungal disease causing orange-brown pustules, most common rust.
symptoms: small, round to oval orange-brown pustules on leaves
Pustules scattered randomly on leaf surface

Wheat Stem fly.description: Maggots bore into the stem destroying central shoot.
prevention: Higher seed rate to compensate loss

Wheat aphid.description: Sucking pests that cluster on leaves and earheads, excreting honeydew.
symptoms: Colonies of green/brown insects on leaves/ears
management_steps: Use Dimethoate if population is high
prevention: Late sowing increases risk (Sow in time)

Wheat black rust.description: Severe rust attacking stems, causing dark brown to black pustules.
symptoms: Elongated dark brown/reddish pustules on STEMS
Lesions turn black as crop matures

Wheat leaf blight.description: Fungal disease causing brown lesions, severe in warm humid areas.
symptoms: Small oval to elongated light brown spots
Spots enlarge and coalesce killing the leaf
Blight appearance starting from lower leaves
management_steps: Mancozeb application at boot leaf stage

Wheat mite.description: Tiny pests causing stippling and discoloration of leaves.
symptoms: Webbing may be visible in severe cases
management_steps: Irrigate field to reduce mite stress

Wheat powdery mildew.description: Fungal disease appearing as white powdery growth on leaves.
symptoms: Patches turn grey-brown later with black dots
Leaves turn yellow and dry up

Wheat scab.description: Fungal disease affecting heads, producing mycotoxins and shriveled grain.
symptoms: Pinkish/orange fungal growth at base of glumes
management_steps: Spray Tebuconazole or Prothioconazole at flowering
Control is difficult once symptoms appear
Harvest early and dry grain quickly

Wheat___Yellow_Rust.description: Cool season rust causing yellow stripes on leaves.
symptoms: Bright yellow pustules aligned in stripes on leaves
Yellow dust (spores) on clothes if walked through

Wilt.description: Soil-borne fungal disease blocking vascular system causing wilting.
symptoms: Drooping and wilting of entire plant
Brown discoloration of vascular tissue (stem cut)
management_steps: Drench soil with Carbendazim or Copper Oxychloride
No effective chemical cure for fully wilted plant

Yellow Rust Sugarcane.description: Fungal disease causing yellowish spots turning to rust.

bacterial_blight in Cotton.description: Bacterial disease causing angular leaf spots and black arm.
symptoms: Blackening of veins and stems (Black Arm)

bollrot on Cotton.description: Complex of pathogens causing rotting of developing bolls.

bollworm on Cotton.description: Larvae bore into bolls causing direct yield loss.
management_steps: Hand pick larvae in small plots

cotton mealy bug.description: White waxy insects sucking sap and causing severe stunting.
symptoms: Twisted and bunched top leaves (Bunchy Top)
management_steps: Spot application on infested plants only
prevention: Destruction of ant nests (ants farm them)

cotton whitefly.description: Small white flying insects sucking sap and transmitting viruses.
symptoms: Tiny white flies flying when plant shaken
management_steps: Apply Neem oil mixed with soap

maize ear rot.description: Fungal infection of the cob/kernels, often producing toxins.
symptoms: Pink, white, or green  mold on kernels

maize fall armyworm.description: Invasive pest causing wide-scale destruction of maize whorls.
symptoms: Larvae marked with inverted 'Y' on head

maize stem borer.description: Larvae bore into stem causing dead hearts and tunneling.
symptoms: Pinholes in straight lines on leaves

pink bollworm in cotton.description: Larvae feed INSIDE seeds and bolls, often undetectable externally.

red cotton bug.description: Red bugs that stain lint and damage seeds.
management_steps: Shake plants to drop bugs into kerosene water

thirps on cotton.description: Tiny fringed insects scraping leaf surface causing silvery patches.
symptoms: Silvery/bronze patches on underside of leaves
Leaves become crinkled and cup upward
